text.section: Except as allowed by § 10-639 of this subtitle, to finance site acquisition and construction of any segment of an Ocean City Convention facility, the Authority shall comply with this section.

The Authority shall provide to the fiscal committees of the General Assembly, at least 90 days before seeking approval of the Board of Public Works for each bond issue or other borrowing, a comprehensive financing plan for the relevant segment of the facility, including the effect of the financing plan on financing options for other segments of the facility.
The Authority shall obtain the approval of the Board of Public Works of the proposed bond issue and the financing plan.

The Authority shall secure a deed, lease, or written agreement with Ocean City, as approved by the Board of Public Works, authorizing the Authority to:
design, construct, and equip, or contract for the design, construction, and equipping of the Ocean City Convention facility expansion; and
pledge the Ocean City Convention facility and the Ocean City Convention site or the leasehold interest in the facility as security for the Authority's bonds.

section.section:
The Authority shall secure a written agreement with Ocean City, as approved by the Board of Public Works:
in which Ocean City agrees to:
subject to paragraph (2) of this subsection, market, promote, and operate the Ocean City Convention facility in a manner that maximizes the facility's economic return;
maintain and repair the facility so as to keep it in first class operating condition; and
be solely responsible for all operating deficits and capital improvements:
that includes provisions that:
protect the respective investment of the Authority and Ocean City;
require:
provide for remedies on default, including the right of the Authority, if a material default by Ocean City is not corrected after a reasonable notice and cure period, to:
Paragraph (1)(i)1 of this subsection may not be construed to require gambling activities in the Ocean City Convention facility.
